class.name: Word.TemplateCollection
class.description: Contains a collection of [Word.Template](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.template) objects that represent all the templates that are currently available. This collection includes open templates, templates attached to open documents, and global templates loaded in the Templates and Add-ins dialog box. To learn how to access this dialog in the Word UI, see Load or unload a template or add-in program: https://support.microsoft.com/office/2479fe53-f849-4394-88bb-2a6e2a39479d.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from the TemplateCollection to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application before performing template operations.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Get all available templates and display their names in the console.

methods.name: getCount
methods.description: Returns the number of items in the collection.

examples.description: Get the total number of templates currently available in Word and display it in the console

methods.name: getItemAt
methods.description: Gets a Template object by its index in the collection.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the template to retrieve.

examples.description: Get the first template from the templates collection and display its name in the console.

methods.name: importBuildingBlocks
methods.description: Imports the building blocks for all templates into Microsoft Word.

examples.description: Import all building blocks from available templates into Word to make them accessible for use in the current document.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the names of all available templates in the Word application

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.TemplateCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TemplateCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Serialize the template collection to JSON format for logging or debugging purposes to inspect available templates and their properties.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a template collection across multiple sync calls to safely access template properties without getting "InvalidObjectPath" errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load the template collection, access its items, and then release the memory associated with the collection after use to optimize performance.
